metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10195 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
lrzsz before version 0.12.21~rc can leak information to the receiving side due to an incorrect length check in the function zsdata that causes a size_t to wrap around. It was discovered that rzsz incorrectly handled integers. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10195` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lrzsz - 0.12.21-10~build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lrzsz package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.21-10~build0.14.04.1').
